methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a stack variable at the specified stack offset with a first-use offset of 0.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name or null for default naming

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: stackOffset
params.comment: signed stack offset

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage 
 address is specified, or unable to resolve storage element for specified datatype

methods.comment: Construct a stack variable at the specified stack offset with a first-use offset of 0.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

params.name: sourceType
params.comment: name source type

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a register variable with the specified register storage.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name or null for default naming

params.name: firstUseOffset
params.comment: first use function-relative offset (i.e., start of scope).

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage 
 element is specified, or error while resolving storage element for specified datatype

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a variable with one or more associated storage elements.  Storage elements
 may get slightly modified to adjust for the resolved datatype size.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name

params.name: firstUseOffset
params.comment: first use function-relative offset (i.e., start of scope).

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

params.name: sourceType
params.comment: name source type

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage 
 element is specified, or error while resolving storage element for specified datatype

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a variable with a single storage element at the specified address.  If address 
 is contained within a register it may get realigned to the register based upon the resolved 
 datatype length.  Variable storage will be aligned to the least-significant portion of the 
 register.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name or null for default naming

params.name: firstUseOffset
params.comment: first use function-relative offset (i.e., start of scope).

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: storageAddr
params.comment: storage address or null if no storage has been identified

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage 
 address is specified, or unable to resolve storage element for specified datatype

methods.comment:
Construct a variable with a single storage element at the specified address.  If address 
 is contained within a register it may get realigned to the register based upon the resolved 
 datatype length.  Variable storage will be aligned to the least-significant portion of the 
 register.

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a variable with one or more associated storage elements.  Storage elements
 may get slightly modified to adjust for the resolved datatype size.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name or null for default naming

params.name: firstUseOffset
params.comment: first use function-relative offset (i.e., start of scope).

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: storage
params.comment: variable storage (may not be null)

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage 
 element is specified, or error while resolving storage element for specified datatype

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a variable with one or more associated storage elements.  Storage elements
 may get slightly modified to adjust for the resolved datatype size.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name or null for default naming

params.name: firstUseOffset
params.comment: first use function-relative offset (i.e., start of scope).

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: storage
params.comment: variable storage (may not be null)

params.name: force
params.comment: if true storage will be forced even if incorrect size

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage 
 element is specified, or error while resolving storage element for specified datatype

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a variable with one or more associated storage elements.  Storage elements
 may get slightly modified to adjust for the resolved datatype size.

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name

params.name: firstUseOffset
params.comment: first use function-relative offset (i.e., start of scope).

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: storage
params.comment: variable storage (may not be null)

params.name: force
params.comment: if true storage will be forced even if incorrect size

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

params.name: sourceType
params.comment: name source type

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated, an invalid storage 
 element is specified, or error while resolving storage element for specified datatype

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a local variable.  Only one storage/location may be specified (storage, storageAddr,
 stackOffset, register) - all others should be null.  If no storage/location is specified
 or is UNASSIGNED, a Void data type may be specified and will be assumed if this type returns
 true for #isVoidAllowed().

params.name: name
params.comment: variable name

params.name: firstUseOffset
params.comment:
first use function-relative offset (i.e., start of scope).
 Must be 0 when stack locations are specified.

params.name: dataType
params.comment:
a fixed-length datatype.  (NOTE: Should be cloned to program datatype manager
 prior to determining storage elements since their length may change)

params.name: storage
params.comment: variable storage or null for unassigned storage (may be null)

params.name: storageAddr
params.comment: storage address or null if no storage has been identified (may be null)

params.name: stackOffset
params.comment: signed stack offset (may be null)

params.name: register
params.comment: register storage (may be null)

params.name: force
params.comment: if true storage will be forced even if mismatch with datatype size

params.name: program
params.comment: target program

params.name: sourceType
params.comment: source type

throws.comment:
if dataType restrictions are violated or an error occurs while 
 resolving storage for specified datatype
